docs.snippet: Under the U.S. Constitution, the Senate has sole authority to confirm a president's nominee to serve in the Cabinet. And while President-elect Donald Trump can't officially nominate anyone until he becomes president on Jan. 20, the Senate is getti...
docs.lead_paragraph: Under the U.S. Constitution, the Senate has sole authority to confirm a president's nominee to serve in the Cabinet. And while President-elect Donald Trump can't officially nominate anyone until he becomes president on Jan. 20, the Senate is getting an early start this week on his choices for several top jobs in his administration.

headline.main: Things to Know About Trump's Cabinet Confirmation Hearings
headline.print_headline: Things to Know About Trump's Cabinet Confirmation Hearings
